intro: Stachys camporum, commonly known as greater betony, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that have a hairy surface. Its flowers are blue to purple, forming whorled clusters at the ends of the stems, and it blooms from June to August. Stachys camporum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky habitats.
